IKEA's home furnishing knowledge should be embedded throughout the journey so
users can learn more about the different product options as they browse and filter.
Using supporting copy, graphic symbols and images, filters can be a good opportunity

Use natural language
Avoid jargon and technical terms that aren't familiar to users. When possible, try to use
language that users can understand and relate to - sometimes that could mean
rewriting some of the words to better describe product features and benefits.

Seeing results update while filtering reassures the user and can help create a positive
perception of responsiveness.
